Weekend is close and everyone deserves to have some fun, ShimmyTheJJ is a great option! Enjoy! #KSP
I'm guessing these posts don't get much posts.

indeed it's much more fun to play game yourself than watch others... i'ts just pointless...   *no offence*

22 minutes ago, Skylar' said:

indeed it's much more fun to play game yourself than watch others... i'ts just pointless...   *no offence*  

KSP is that kind of game. The only commentary that goes well over it is science-y commentary a la Scott Manley or the like. It's not very well suited to the style of the (aptly named) Twitch streaming community.

15 hours ago, Skylar' said:

indeed it's much more fun to play game yourself than watch others... i'ts just pointless...   *no offence*  

Have either of you watched ShimmytheJJ before?  He's incredibly engaging and is actually a joy to watch.  He's been a top KSP streamer on Twitch for a long time before he took what was likely a well-needed 3 or so month break from streaming.  He was also one of the main KSP streamers on KSPTV for a long time.  I myself missed his streams a lot while he was away, he always has interesting designs and plays with a variety of different mods...from an RSS install to KAS/KIS and full LS suite, interplanetary launch pads, etc... so always something interesting to see.

While I understand it may be something you guys aren't into...the statement that "i'ts (sic) just pointless" is just like...your opinion man and shouldn't be stated as fact as it's not one.  I also agree that Twitch Thursdays on the Daily Kerbal are fairly lacking and I think SQUAD should make a change; that discussion has already happened in the community and SQUAD has apparently decided to make no change in that regard (at least thus far).

@Ignath: Oh yeah, I totally forgot about DasValdez and Shimmy and that sort of thing. DasValdez in particular is awesome-I love how he leverages the live format with his Kerbal Space Academy series, beyond the "hey guyz put 1 in chat if u think I should do dis thing" of many streamers. While I respect people that do that and simply enjoy the long-form setup of streaming, I also think the best examples of the live format are tutorials, because you can take questions live from people watching. (Speaking of long-form, why can't I ever accidentally write half an essay when I'm doing homework?)
